intro: Conyza sophiifolia, commonly known as the whitehead weed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Africa and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and serrated, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, white, and clustered in a head, which is often mistaken for a single flower. Conyza sophiifolia is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed soils, making it a common weed in agricultural and natural environments.
